Reviews.Title: “Clean honest, well located”
Reviews.Author: mychka-tsunami
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights there last week awaiting a cruise departure on Carnival Victory Clean room, well maintained, free continental breakfast, free washer and dryer after 3 pm, nice large balcony on Avenida Rivera, close to Caribe Hilton and walking distance to a beautiful beach Can be noisy am because of all the tourist buses that like to leave their diesel engine idling prior to going to pick-up passengers at the Hilton 10 minutes walk to the Condado area across the bridge Nice area for walking beach, park close by About 45 minutes by foot to the Panam cruise pier Would return there again

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CodHaddock
Reviews.Content: I'm currently sitting in a filthy bed in this hotel. The maid took half my sheets and has left for the day. There is an empty room next door with clean sheets but am not allowed to take the sheet. It's "against protocol". I am not allowed to contact the manager to ask her if I can take the sheets. This is against protocol too. Effectively the manager is saying that her saving 2 minutes talking to me is more important than me saving 30 minutes and hassle by changing rooms. Rooms are tiny and miserable. You do your own laundry. With your own detergent. But only after 4pm. Not worth the money you save.

Reviews.Title: “very good deal and location!”
Reviews.Author: asnaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, friendly staff, they let us check in at 9am when usually check in was 3pm, it's well located in Condado, a cab to old san juan is about 10-12dlls or you can walk, it's around the corner of the Caribe Hilton, you can also walk to the beach, the rooms are good size, we got the cheapest and we sleep very quietly, there's an elevator in the hotel which we didn't find at any other hotel we stayed in puerto rico, there's breakfast included: fruit, cereal, muffins, toast, juice, coffee, it's very complete. theres free wireless, there's a TV good size flat screen, and there's a hair dryer as well, outside you can find a few restaurants including subway for those fast food lovers, there's starbucks inside the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with great staff and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Keri Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Park Hotel for five nights for our trip to Puerto Rico. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Rudy. During our trip, Rudy was our go-to guy for everything. He recommended great restaurants and set up all of our tours. This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and Rudy gave us lots of great tips and recommendations. The room was pretty small, but you don't visit Puerto Rico to stay inside your hotel room. The bed was really comfortable and basically we needed a place to sleep and shower between all of our adventures. The hotel was perfect for that. We were up pretty early and the breakfast area was great for fruit, muffins, and most importantly, coffee. The hotel has a great location and it was a quick taxi ride from the airport, a short walk to Old San Juan (about 30 mins), a short walk to the Condado area (about 20-30 mins) and a short walk (5 mins) to a beach. We don't like to drive or ride in taxis and we were able to walk everywhere we went (except to and from the airport). There was a great restaurant next door (Nativo Sauce) and a Subway for quick eats. For the tours, the guides picked us up right at the hotel. If we travel to Puerto Rico again, we would stay here and I would recommend this place to anyone who plans to visit.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan pre-cruise hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TallyLassie59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Old San Juan. We stayed here two nights, prior to embarking on a cruise leaving from San Juan. It's approximately one mile from Old San Juan--can walk there from the hotel. The check-in was very easy--we arrived a little early; but, our room was ready--so, we were able to check in. Rudy, the hotel desk person, was very friendly and helpful. Our room was a Junior suite--a queen-sized bed, dresser, nice tv; bathroom (although sink was located in the bedroom area--which was fine). We also had a balcony, overlooking the street in front of the hotel. The air conditioner worked very well; and because we were able to have the air conditioner fan on all night, were not bothered at all by nighttime street noises (cars, etc). The room was clean; and the bed was very comfortable. There was a continental breakfast included in our room reservation--cereal, milk, muffins, toast, bagels, juices, fresh fruits (apples, bananas). The hotel is also close to Condado beach area--within walking distance--very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for traveler on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Erin L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a two minute walk from the beach, one minute walk to a bus (which takes you to Old San Juan for 50-75 cents---bring quarters!), next door to the Caribe Hilton which you can hang out on the first floor of and get some starbucks, a five minute walk to Condado which is right across the bridge and has some good restaurants (if you sit in the back of the oceanside restaurants you can watch the waves crash on the rocks while you dine--- so beautiful and romantic) and the Condado Hilton which has a large casino. The area around San Juan Park Hotel/PR Supreme Court for the most part is very cultural and quaint. The room we stayed in itself was certainly small but perfect for the traveler who is going to be out all day anyway and wants to save some money. This must be the best deal you can find in this area. As for other adventures, the front desk person, Rudy, was VERY helpful. We wanted to see El Yunque Rainforest and go Bio Bay Kayaking and he made the phone call himself to arrange to have a bus come pick us up the next morning. We got to do both adventures for a flat $125 each when its usually $150+tax. On our last night he took us to a non-touristy bar to see how the real PR locals party, and then took us to a island famous food truck "El Churry" where we ate the most amazing sandwiches you could imagine (even Man vs. Food did an episode there!) Our experience staying at the San Juan Park Hotel was very nice... The location+culture+Rudy=One unforgettable trip.

Reviews.Title: “El Depresso”
Reviews.Author: jwpepper_66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in early March/ 2012. We booked on Orbitz, and our stay was paid in advance. Had we been able to get a refund, we would have changed hotels in a heartbeat. The regular rooms are TINY. They are so poorly lit, that I was not able to shave properly. The rooms, and the entire hotel is depressing. Don't even think about staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, inexpensive place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Randy T
Reviews.Content: Management/owners of the SJPH need to do two things: First: reward Rudy, the desk concierge, for being such an hospitable and informative, not to mention responsive and an extremely friendly host; second, fix the windows facing the street (the sound was as though we were staying on the sidewalk of a major highway) because, otherwise, the experience at the hotel was excellent. Close enough to nice restaurants and the bus stop. Quick taxi service calls and minutes from the airport. Tips: For the beach, walk across the Ashford Avenue bridge, to a small cove, or along the sea-shore to Escambron, a larger, more open beach. For any directions, recommendations, etc., ask Rudy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda336
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb. 18, the night before our cruise. Found it to be a great location. Subway and convenience store next door. Easy three minute walk to beach and bus stop nearby for a ten minute ride to go to Old San. Five minute taxi ride to cruise ship pier for Carnival cruise. We had a king suite with a balcony which was perfect for our one night stay. Continental breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Park-good stopover”
Reviews.Author: eileen d
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at San Juan Park Hotel as a stopover as it is very close to Isla Grande General Aviation Airport and is close enough to walk to Old San Juan. Located near the Hilton Caribe it is easy to access. From the outside it seems rather plain, but the place is clean and the rooms have been refurbished. They are small but comfortable. the best thing about the lace is the two very helpful desk clerks. Rudy helped us with some arrangedments, got us an upgrade to a King Bed and recommended the restaurant next door, Nativo Sauce, which had great affordable local food and a jazz jam with local musicians that night. Totally enjoyable. If you need a place just to land for a night or two........ it works. They also have a buffet breakfast. Nothing but the basics...but , again,it all works.

Reviews.Title: “pre/post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Kamarsh442
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice to stay at the San Juan Park Hotel pre and post cruise. It was much more affordable than staying in OSJ, the rooms were clean and the service was good. Water pressure in the shower wasn't great, and the 'breakfast' was pretty wiped out by the time we got there at 9am. Air conditioner worked great and we loved having a balcony room. We had one minor issue with the balcony door not shutting, and the front desk staff immediatly went to find a screwdriver and fixed it with many apologies. After the cruise we stopped to see if we could drop our bags off at 10 and wander around OSJ even though check in wasn't until 3. They said our room was ready and let us check in at 10. It was a quick walk to find dinner, or was right next to Subway. Quick taxi ride to the cruise port. Would stay here again if leaving from the same port.

Reviews.Title: “It will do.”
Reviews.Author: Gary F
Reviews.Content: Not too too bad for a quick 1 night stop over. Nice free continental breakfast and decent location. The bed was not good at all. Very small room. There was some type of concert going on close by so there were a lot of people on the street the evenibg we arrived. Had a nice walk to the beach and surrounding area in the morning. Taxi from SJU airport for 5 people with luggage and tip was $40. Taxi to cruise port for 8 people with tip was $40. Not too bad. The restaurant next door was closed so hard to find food close by except Subway. Staff were friendly and only real complaint is the bed. Not sure if I would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: WintersR4beaches
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the San Juan Park. The location was perfect. It is about a 30 min. walk from Old San Juan. As others have said, the rooms are small but certainly adequate if you don't intend to spend all day in the room. Each floor has a small balcony where you and friends can sit and chat. We found the rooms clean and loved having a small refrigerator in our room. We arrived during the feast of San Sebastian which brings thousands of people to Old San Juan. The roads were traffic nightmares so walking to the festivities was perfect yet the hotel was quiet enough in the evenings to get a good night's sleep. The front desk staff was very helpful in answering questions and let us leave our luggage for a couple of hours after we checked out. They were even kind enough to let our daughter and her husband leave their suitcases while they were between flights from the states to Vieques even though they were just meeting us. A simple breakfast is included. They had packaged muffins, bread, lunch meat, juice, coffee and cereal as well as apples and bananas. They could have done better with that. Some rolls and cheese would have been nice. Many cruises leave from San Juan and the location is just a short cab ride from the piers. It is also conveniently near Isla Grande Airport where the flights leave for Vieques and other islands. This is a perfect no frills hotel if you are passing through San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, clean. Excellent budget choice”
Reviews.Author: CarolHK_10
Reviews.Content: A mile or so, pleasant walk, from Old San Juan. Closer to Condado Playa public beach and onward to restaurants in Condado. Buses in both directions pass nearby and cost 75cents, less for seniors. A shady park is across the road. The hotel is flanked by a cosy trattoria and by a convenience store. A Subway fast-food is two doors away. The Caribe Hilton, where there's a car rental office, is around the corner. The hotel is small, clean, well-equipped. Rooms have good mattresses, good pillow supply, plenty of towels, toiletries, iron and board, TV, coffee maker (I think), desk, easy chair, TV/dresser, air-conditioning, balcony with 2 chairs and a table. Breakfast in airy, sunny 4th floor. Coffee (no tea or decaf), milk, juices, fresh fruits, cold cereal, bread (toaster), packaged muffins & sweet rolls, butter, jam. Washing machine available after 3 PM; dryer available also. A previous guest detected an odor in the room; my husband didn't but I did. It was like a hayloft, nothing moldy or dirty as the hotel is very clean. Detecting it must depend on individual physiology and apparently most people don't. Although facing a busy street, our room was not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great, RUDY is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Josh D
Reviews.Content: I spend 1 week every month in PR on business and usually stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Isla Verde. It's a nice resort style hotel, but their service SUCKS!!! I decided to give San Juan Park Hotel a try due to positive reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel is nice, quaint, quiet, clean, and comfortable. It is located a few minutes from the airport but far enough away where you don't hear the planes all night. It is in a safe area, within walking distance to the beach, and many historical buildings. There are a lot of places to eat and everybody around the hotel speaks English. Free wi fi, fridge in the room, free washer and dryer, free breakfast, and $60 less than the Courtyard. Now for the service. Rudy at the front desk is awesome. Nice guy, made sure I was comfortable, he told me the good places to eat, safe areas to go to, where to park, he just made the whole week long stay stress free and enjoyable. When you arrive, ask for Rudy, he will make sure you're taken care of and everything is perfect for you. I'll see you next month Rudy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShakieG
Reviews.Content: The parking is off site just couple blocks. This is a small hotel more like a motel. The front desk was very friendly. The appearance is fresh. The room size is moderate and clean. The is a small refrigerator in the room. The bathroom was very clean with walk in shower. This is a 3 star hotel with and extra star for budget price. One warning, the bed (king) is very, very firm. Not to my liking. I would stay here again if I wanted to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for one night.”
Reviews.Author: Crystalvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the San Juan Park the night before our cruise left. The rooms are small, but clean, and the air conditioning works well.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VanessaL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the San Juan Park Hotel prior to a cruise. Fare from the airport (plus luggage) was $22.50. Check in was efficient. We were in a "suite", which unfortunately is on the front side of the building where the highway is. We asked about noise and the front desk clerk said we could move to the back side of the building but the rooms were smaller. We met up with friends for dinner and by the time we got back to the hotel we were exhausted (been up since 5AM flying) so we just crashed in our room. I didn't hear any noise but I know that is because I was so tired. Ordinarily I sleep very lightly so it helped that I was very tired. On checking in we realized our key was not effectively opening the door (it took reinserting it 6 or 7 times before it triggered the mechanism to open it). When we returned from dinner we stopped at the front desk and asked for a new key and the front desk clerk said, "If it gives you anymore trouble it may be the battery and will need to be checked." Sure enough, the second key took 7 or 8 tries but we were so exhausted by that time we just kept the key and told them when we checked out that there was an issue. Water pressure (which is very important to me) was virtually non existent in the shower. That might've made sense if we were on the top floor but we were only on the 2nd floor :P The room is very basic, as you will see in the pictures. The bed was very comfortable but the room was on the small side for a "suite". I guess adding the refrigerator makes it a suite. Not sure. Breakfast was very basic, toast, prepackaged honey buns, cereals and fruit. Nothing hot. The coffee was good though. Unfortunately, when we arrived to the breakfast (about 9:30AM) almost all the items were gone. This took a trip down 4 floors (it was faster to go up and down the stairs as the elevator is the slowest on the planet, I am convinced) to ask the front desk clerk to have it checked. After approximately 10 minutes or so 2 of the house keepers came up and restocked the breakfast. It would be helpful if they had someone on that duty the time the breakfast is open. Overall it was an ok stay but for the money ($109) I will definitely choose another location in 2013 when we are to cruise out of San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Erin N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days. It was great! We got there at 9 am the first day, well before check in time and they were kind enough to give us a room right at 9 so we could rest! The staff is so friendly and helpful. The beach at Condado is within walking distance. Old San Juan is a long walk, but we did it twice so it was great. You can also take the bus to told San Juan from right by the hotel for .75 each person, a bargain! I travel 24 weeks out of the year for my job so I stay in a lot of hotels. You cannot beat this hotel for the friendly staff and the great cost! I was very impressed and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations satisfied”
Reviews.Author: esjay719
Reviews.Content: October 22 - 23, 2011. I decided to arrive one day early for my cruise and at the last minute attempted to get an affordable, yet satisfactory hotel. The San Juan Park Hotel was exactly what I needed for just one night. It was affordable, clean, and located in a very nice area (accessible to everything). My friends stayed at a much more expensive hotel, and I was able to walk about 10 minutes to meet them. I contacted the hotel and spoke direclty with Rudy (Rodolfo Vargas) at the front desk. He was so pleasant and professional that I immediately decided to make the reservation. During my stay, the entire staff was also pleasant and I will definitely stay there again. The room was small, but very clean and the TV and all plumbing worked. I recommend this hotel very highly in terms of affordablity, location, and highly acceptable customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed plus the great customer service made it fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Juan Angel D
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, a short walk to Old San Juan and to condado and even a shorter walk to the beach. They have the usual complimentary breakfast which was more than enough. The room was a little small but who needs more space? If your spending your day at the hotel while in PR, your wasting your time, with that said, we just needed a place to sleep while exploring the island. The customer service was exceptional as was the staff, Monica was very helpful but Rudy treated me like if he'd known me for years. I was very appreciative of that! Next time in PR, I'm definitely staying here again...Rudy, you rock!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like I was appreciated even during an emergency...”
Reviews.Author: aaron r
Reviews.Content: Hotel front desk agent, Rudy gave my girlfriend and I a room in the wake of a hurricane where we were literally desparate for a place with power and running water. He made sure we got a room that was fully prepped for a stay despite the struggles of dealing with the rooms that were affected with flooding and wind damage. Service with a smile was all we got for the entire stay 3 day stay. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to my family and friends without hesitation. I did not feel a spec of dirt on the floor when I walked barefoot and the bed was very comfy. They give continental breakfast and wifi also. Two thumbs up for this establishment!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay and going back!”
Reviews.Author: Rollin A
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, cozy and immaculate hotel. The hotel staff "Rudy" provided excellent customer service. Rudy made us feel at home and provided top quality service. The room was clean, cozy and nice. The location is great if you want to experience the San Juan area. The rooms were comfortable and everything was clean. The hotel also provides a light breakfast for free. I would recommend this hotel anytime, but don't forget to look for Rudy...he is the man!

Reviews.Title: “A small but clean and comfortable hotel. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DCintron88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very enjoyable for my girlfriend and I. Room service was on point, and the man at the front desk who was there the night we arrived was awesome. His name is Rudy Vargas, and he was nice enough to tell us anything we needed to know about the Island, popular spots and gave us plenty of good recommendations. Everyone else at the hotel was friendly, and my 7 days spent at this hotel was well worth the reasonable cost. If I come back to PR this is the hotel I will stay at. Thanks Rudy

Reviews.Title: “awesome service....... next time i come to puerto rico i will definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: oscarll18
Reviews.Content: if it wasn't for rudy the guy from reception this trip would had suck !!!!! i got stranded in puerto rico because of the tropical storm irene, and he helped me make the best out of my stay !!! the hotel is small but comfortable, the rooms are great... thanks for making this vacation worth it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to hang your hat and sleep with both eyes closed...restful”
Reviews.Author: JeannieSF
Reviews.Content: A quick cab ride from San Juan Airport to the San Juan Park Hotel. We checked in, unpacked, showered and went out to the Morton's Steak House around the corner at the Hilton. This spot is convenient to all sightseeing locations. 20 min. walk into old town and you can get the hotel to call a cab and in no time your already there. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. We will be back for a longer stay. Thanks for the hospitality. This was a bargain find.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, welcoming, a hidden gem...”
Reviews.Author: sky_9
Reviews.Content: There's nothing like spending a day discovering and walking all of Old San Juan and then getting back to your hotel to unwind... The bathrooms are newly renovated, very clean, great water pressure... relaxing and spacious... The beds are comfortable as well. We stayed in the Suite King with Twin and it was perfect for what we needed. I don't know about you but I'd prefer to spend my time outside the hotel enjoying the island. Bottom line, the price was reasonable. I've stayed there three times now, and the only negative thing I can say about it is that I always get allergies (I'm very sensitive and allergic) perhaps because when you first open your room the rooms are never left with the A/C on... but it has never smelled bad. But yes, I always get allergies. On the plus side, they do have a very conveniently located mini market that's opened late and carries just about everything you may need or may have forgotten back home. There's also a highly recommended restaurant where you can have Puerto Rican food at a great price and superb service. This is a must try if you're in the area, I believe they're called Nativa... just opened. The hotel lacks a pool (which made the kids sad) but we had the beach nearby!

Reviews.Title: “GOING BACK IN JANUARY !”
Reviews.Author: jennieedee
Reviews.Content: when i called the hotel to confirm everything the day before the trip i spoke to a man named RUDY, I was very worried about the trip being it was me and my boyfriendâ€™s first time to san juan but he assured me we would have a great time and made me super excited. When we first arrived it was before check in and they quickly set us up in a room within minutes. At first I was shocked at the room size because it was super small but hey you get what you pay for â€¦. And thatâ€™s the only bad thing about the hotel â€¦ The STAFF WAS GREAT ESPECIALLY RUDY ! â€¦ the hotel BReAKFAST is FULLING NOTHING SPEACIAL BUT IT DID THE JOB ohh and ALSO BEFORE WE LEFT WE DID ALL OUR LAUNDRY FOR FREE SINCE THEY HAVE A WASHER MACHINE YOU CAN USE ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS GET YOUR OWN SOAP .. me and my boyfriend WALKED TO MANY OTHER NEIGHBORHOODS NEAR BY THIS HOTEL HAS A GREAT LOCATION RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHINGâ€¦. RUDY TOLD US ABOUT A FESTIVAL IN JANUARY which we cant wait to goâ€¦ THIS HOTEL IS GREAT FOR THE PRICE THE STAFF IS SOOO FRIENDLY AND I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADobkin
Reviews.Content: Others have posted accurate reviews, so I'm not going to repeat what they said. But we enjoyed this hotel and would definitely stay here again. It is not a huge resort, but if you just need a nice clean place to stay at night and then plan to go out exploring during the day (which is what we did), then it is perfect, and you can't beat their rates. Parking is a bit expensive in the nearby deck, but there is some free parking on the streets a mile or two away if you don't mind walking. If you want a hot breakfast, there is a a Subway right next door which is good, fast, cheap, and has a bigger breakfast selection (eggs made to order) than most other Subways in the US. If you want to check out the resort nightlife/bar, need a Starbucks fix, etc., the Caribe Hilton is also right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem nestled between 5 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: tparry86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Juan Park Hotel before and after a cruise. $99/ night and loved it! 15 min. drive from airport by taxi, 10 min. taxi ride to ship pier, 5 min. walk to beautiful beaches! If you blinked you might drive right past this hidden gem. The beds are comfortable. The staff was amazing. They even let us use their washer/dryer!!! They let us check in early after our cruise. Breakfast was simple, but nice. I would definitely would stay here again and I would highly recommend to my friends. Service was personal and accommodating. Bedrooms were quaint, clean, and comfortable. All rooms are decorated differently. Location is convenient. Bedroom and bathroom are all tiled. small fridge in room. Getting a taxi only took 3 minutes. Subway restaurant right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: jugigrja
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1-night, pre-cruise, stay at this hotel in March. The hotel was very clean, we were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist and were given a large street view room. Seen that there's no restaurant in the hotel, and the fact that it was our first stay in San Juan, we asked the receptionist where we could find one at reasonable prices. He gave us directions to a local restaurant where we had a great meal at cheap prices (my wife had lobster for only 15 $ !). Seen the fact that we arrived in Puerto Rico without our luggage (thank you Iberia ;) ) we asked the receptionist where we could buy some clothes. Again we were given immediately directions to a shopping mall where we could buy all we needed, so that we had some clothes to start our cruise. The only negative we can say is that, due to the fact that the hotel is located on a very busy road, there's quite a lot of noise at night. Final conclusion, great value for money. We wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the money and a clean place to say”
Reviews.Author: Rebec-PDX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Juan Park twice, before and after a cruise. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable. The room was a small and there wasn't a good view (which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5) but it was functional and safe, and that was all we needed. The neighborhood includes a Subway right next door, and the Hotel Caribe around the corner. There is a beach very close by the all the locals go to, as well as a large park---both the beach and park are enjoyable. It is a long walk (maybe 40 min to 1 hour, depending on how fast you walk) into the heart of Old San Juan. The breakfast in the morning is very basic, with apples, bananas, cereal and muffins, but it is nice to have something. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Overall, I would stay there again and I would recommend this hotel to others. It is a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: everfair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at San Juan Park Hotel for three nights for a long weekend getaway. Overall, we were very satisfied. We got a great rate on Orbitz. We checked in late (past midnight) but that was not a problem. We parked in front of the hotel, which is fine overnight (and on Saturday supposedly, as we took a gamble and did not get ticketed). The clerk was helpful in directing us to where to find a late night bite to eat in Old San Juan (we ended up picking up Burger King anyways). The room was sufficient for our needs. We had a queen sized bed (although I prefer booking a king when I stay at hotels, we booked their standard room) that was firm but comfortable. The pillows could have been fluffier but we slept soundly. The room ac was very powerful; sleeping with it was very chilly, but sleeping without it made the room very humid and uncomfortable. After a while, we found a setting that suited us. We were also surprised that there was a fridge in the room, which allowed us to keep our water cold. The bathroom was fine, with a shower stall. The one thing that was aggravating was that our room key seemed to be very tempermental. Wifi worked fine. The included self-service continental breakfast is on the fourth floor. The local bananas are yummy. Coffee was good. Cereals, milk, pastries, ham and bread for toasting also available. We went to see family and attend the Saborea food festival, which was at nearby Escambron beach. For us, the location was great. The Caribe Hilton was nearby as well and a beautiful facility with some nice restaurants and shops within the resort to visit. We would consider San Juan Park Hotel again should we stay in San Juan to attend Saborea.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff member”
Reviews.Author: travelbug5457
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight which got us into San Juan around 6am. I had emailed the hotel prior to our stay and asked about early check in, and they said they would try to accommodate if they could (and if they didn't have a room available yet they would gladly store our luggage). I didn't go in there thinking that they would have rooms available that early, but thought at least we would ask. The man working the front desk very rudely said "check in is at 3." Okay, well I emailed someone who said they would accommodate us if there was something available before then. He said again "check in is at 3." When we asked if he could store our bags, he pointed to a chair in the lobby and told us to put our bags behind it. We went and wandered aimlessly through the town, coming back around noon. At least at that point there was someone new at the desk who was more willing to help us. They finally had a room available for us around 1, so we went to go nap (were completely exhausted from our red eye flight and wandering) only to find there was some sort of construction going on directly below us. The construction noises were still going on at 7:30 pm when we left for dinner. It was so noisy and went on for a ridiculous amount of time (it was a Saturday!) Later in the evening, we came back to the hotel to find the rude man working the front desk. No hello or even a smile when we walked into the hotel. We were really happy to only be spending one night here. In addition to the rudeness and the noise, our room was tiny and the hotel was not near anything but the Caribe Hilton. I guess we got what we paid for. Only positive was it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just know what you're getting and you'll be fine.”
Reviews.Author: Peggy46151
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive hotel. Do not expect deluxe accomodations. Having said that, we enjoyed our two night stay here mid Feb 2011. The room was small, did not have a desk, chair or reading lamp. There was a TV and small refrigerator in the room. Also A/C. There was a balcony, but the street noise was very high so we did not use it. There are two public "sun decks" (larger balconies) with small tables and chairs. Even though it was noisy too, we did sit out to play cards. Complimentary breakfast in a servicable (not charming) area. Washer and dryer available. Long but lovely walk to Old San Juan. Wear good shoes and a hat. We walked to and from and all around the forts and shops and we are in our 60s. Staff very friendly and helpful. Subway sandwiches next door. Small convenience store on other side. Nice steak house (Morton's)1/2 block away in Hilton. Pretty beaches and parks very close. As long as you don't expect too much, your stay here will please you. It appears to have been recently painted and decorated with some cute touches. Cute little building. $20 ride to the airport. Free wifi. Bed clean and comfortable. No bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but did the job for one night pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: canadiantyler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Juan Park Hotel for one night prior to a cruise. The price was very reasonable, which is why we chose it since we wouldn't be there long. The room that we got was very tiny, but again it was fine for one night. The hotel and room were very clean and modern looking (not outdated). The location is OK. There is a Subway next door and a variety store with alcohol. It is close to the Hilton as well - they have a restaurant on-site. There was continental breakfast included, the usual stuff - cereal, pastries, toast, etc. which was sufficient. We walked to Old San Juan, about 30 min approx. walk which was nice, but decided to take a taxi on the way back. Taxi driver didn't know where the hotel was, so we had to give him the address. Would stay there again if going down for a night pre-cruise, but would probably look elsewhere if we were staying longer or vacationing in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “great value. helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jakeyman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last weekend after spending six days on Vieques Island. I was planning to meet a friend who was staying in a different hotel only to find that her hotel had lost her reservation. When I inquired at the San Juan Park Hotel about vacancies, I was told that they had no other basic rooms but that I could share my room or upgrade to a junior suite. I upgraded to the junior suite which was perfect for our needs, and the hotel did not charge me for the upgrade! Prior to traveling to Vieques, I had stayed for one night at a similarly priced hotel and had an unpleasant stay. My stay at the San Juan Park Hotel was so different.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before and after our cruise”
Reviews.Author: RoadyWI
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located to Old San Juan, the Airport and the cruise piers. Very clean functional rooms. Front Desk Staff speaks fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JannaMarie26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 1 night before leaving for Vieques. It was very nice, clean hotel at a reasonable rate. Perfect for what we needed. It is located within walking distance of the public beach and a local park. It is also convenient to take a cab or the bus into Old San Juan. If you want to spend a lot of time in Old San Juan, I would not recommend this hotel, butI would recommend it if you are only in San Juan for a brief time or will only be spending a day or two in Old San Juan. It's also convenient to both airports.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean rooms - good for overnight before cruise.”
Reviews.Author: CaLittleRed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before leaving on a Carnival Cruise. The rooms are very small but clean w/ working A/C. I was glad our room was on the back of the hotel so we didn't face the busy street below. The location is about a 45 min walk from Old Town San Juan. Part of the walk in thru a run down area. During the day it was fine but wouldn't recommend the walk at night - take taxi. We arrived late at night (after 1 am) & they had someone at the desk to check us in. Staff was very nice & helpful. They had accidentally charged us twice before us stay & when I made them aware of it, they refunded it immediately. They provide packaged Ottis Spunkmeyer muffins & juice in the morning. They also stored our luggage for us after we checked out, but wanted to explore the City before boarding the cruise ship. The taxi ride is about 5-10 min to the Carnival cruise pier.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great service... great value”
Reviews.Author: jdebellas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had one night in San Juan on a budget and picked this hotel after redading the reviews. The room is modest, but the entire hotel is impeccably clean. The clerk, Ana, made us feel like VIP guests, including reserving us parking on the curb in front of the hotel. The hotel is a 1 mile walk along the ocean from Old San Juan and right next door to the Caribe Hilton for 1/3 the price. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBay-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan park hotel for a night before and a night after our cruise. The hotel is basic but nice. It is clean and comfortable but, I am not sure I would book it for a vacation stay. It is located close to cruise ship docks and to old San Juan. If I was taking a cruise out of San Juan again and needed a place to stay the night or two before I would book this hotel again. The hotel was wonderful about getting us cabs when we needed them and the breakfast was basic but good. If you expect the kind that you get in north american hotels then you will be disappointed. We liked it and the friends we were travelling with liked it as well. We recommend it to anyone who likes value for their dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Five star staff”
Reviews.Author: homeandawayVictoria
Reviews.Content: Not a terribly convenient location, but an easy bus ride for 50 cents to Old San Juan. Staff could not be more helpful and caring, especially Linette. Rooms small but comfortable. Breakfast sparse but adequate. A nice public beach close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people, room and value! We'll be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: mrsterric
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before and the night after our cruise. The staff was way beyond wonderful, the rooms were immaculate and the beds very comfortable. It was a little noisy with the main highway just below our balcony, but it didn't bother our sleep at all. The continental breakfast is plentiful... fruit, toast, cereal, yogurt, muffins, coffee, milk and juice. They are located a little ways from Old San Juan. We were first told that it was just a 15 minute walk to a restaurant that was actually 40 minutes away by foot. If you don't mind grabbing a taxi for $12 to get to the forts, Old San Juan sites, etc., then this is a great place to stay. We were disappointed that there was not a safe in the room tho. There is a small general store and a Subway sandwich shop next door which was very convenient. We truly enjoyed our stay and plan on staying again when we return! Thanks so much to San Juan Park Hotel for making us feel so welcome and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KanawhaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We set up reservations ahead with Expedia. It was no problem. We took a taxi from the RC cruise pier to the hotel. Had a nice stay. The ladies behind the desk were very helpful. They called a taxi for us in the morning to take us to the airport. Breakfast was slim but enough to get by.

Reviews.Title: “La perfect Suite”
Reviews.Author: rogerbwhour
Reviews.Content: Awesome place for vacation, honeymoon etc. Quiet, great atmosphere and tolerance you can do everything without people looking or staring at you!

Reviews.Title: “We had a lot of fun at the resort”
Reviews.Author: biglady_bear
Reviews.Content: My friends & I enjoyed the resort. The people were friendly. We liked the culture.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel on the edge of Old San Juan. Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: robertocollins
Reviews.Content: Clean room with small fridge and balcony. Our room overlooked the street which was noisy, especaily for us small town quiet loving people. Everything else was just, great though. If you stay there, get an inside room. We left a box of gifts in the room and they were kind enough to send them to us at home. Honesty says a lot. They are right on the bus line into the heart of Old San Juan and just around the corner from the Hilton Caribe. We were very happy at this hotel as we always search out small places that are well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed for a one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: cuda52774
Reviews.Content: Just like most of the reviews for this hotel, our visit with San Juan Park Hotel was pleasant for the price. We arrived a little late and they took good care of us, getting our key in a timely manner. The room was small, the bed was firm, the a/c does blow on the bed (which was perfectly ok for me) and the sink is in the room with you. The bathroom is also small but much more luxurious than expected with tile walls and floors. See pics. My wife says the water pressure in the shower left a little something to be desired. The full size bed was a little small for us but we're used to a king so that's just us. Our only real problem was that the remote to the tv was broken so that there was tape trying (unsuccessfully) to hold the batteries in. Since we were only staying for the one night we didn't take advantage of the free continental breakfast. We were advised to take advantage of the best breakfast spot in Old San Juan. La Bombonera is the best place for pastries and mallorcas. There really is no place to eat on a budget near the hotel except for the Subway. We found them to be unfriendly and they charged my credit card for a $1.50 tip that I didn't authorize. All that with a sign that said "no tipping accepted". The restaurants at the Hilton were overly expensive. $14 for a cheeseburger plate. Check out was fast and friendly and they let us leave our bags in the hotel so that we could go sight seeing. Overall a very friendly stay. Oh and don't let the taxi's charge you more than $12 to get into old San Juan or $19 to get to or from the international airport. Their fees are mandated by law and we didn't have time to wait for the bus. But take full advantage of the free trolley in old San Juan.

HotelInfo.Name: San Juan Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ave. Munoz Rivera #54 | Puerta de Tierra, San Juan 00902, Puerto Rico
